Welcome to My Blog

At some point on this page, I will make posts about various subjects ranging from personal interests, tutorials, as well as my take on some important world problems that need to be addressed.

This blog is broken into 3 sections. In the first, I will share some of the most common and frustrating technical bugs that I have encountered, as well as the solutions I have found. My goal here is to help you get to the starting line of the development process and avoid the obnoxious technical hurdles along the way.

In the second section, I will create posts summarizing technical concepts, and provide links to working implementations. I believe that one of the best ways to acutally learn a new concept is to teach it, so this section is as much for my benefit as it is yours.

In the last section of my blog, I'll write about some topics I find thought provoking. These could range from my thoughts on Oneill colonies and space exploration, to the development and democratization of home genetics labs, as people like Josiah Zayner and his company ODIN deliver CRISPR kits to your front door.

Debugging

When I encounter a common problem, as well as a potential solution, I'll share it here.
